comments.html: Yeah, Arista and Cisco launching competing products on the same day must be a pure coincidence ;) More details on Nexus 3548 here: http://blog.ioshints.info/2012/09/cisco-nexus-3548-victory-for-custom.html
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
http://www.lightreading.com/document.asp?doc_id=225068

Cisco's Nexus 3548, announced Wednesday morning, claims latency of 190 nanoseconds through the switch, compared with Arista's 350 nanoseconds.
The 3548 is the switch Cisco was supposedly marketing as an "Arista killer." And it got announced on the same day that Arista unveiled its 350-nanosecond latency switches, the new 7150 series.
comments.name: Doronin Pavel

With 12.5 Brocade ADX L4-L7 switches can act as VTEPs. It has been announced on Aug. It is supported on existing product line of ADX series.
